intro: Meliosma minutipetala, commonly known as the small-petaled meliosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
